## Sun is the Earth's primary form of heat, via radiation
<hr>
<br />
<br />
<br />
<br />

<div style="float: left; width: 45%;">

* **~1/3 of sunlight energy reflects back to space**

<br />

* **Rest is absorbed by land, ocean and atmosphere**

<br />

* **Exact amount absorbed depends on both surface and atmosphere**
</div>

## Composition of the atmosphere
<hr>
<br />

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:275px; LEFT:75px; WIDTH:400px; HEIGHT:300px" SRC="images/air-composition.jpg">

<div style="float: right; width: 50%;">
<br />

* **Gases have different residence times**
    + N<sub>2</sub> = 13 million years
    + O<sub>2</sub> = 10,000 years
    + N<sub>2</sub>0 = 114 years
    + **CO<sub>2</sub> = 5-200 years (1/2 removed quickly)**
    + **CH4 (methane) = 12 years**

<br />
<br />

* **Water vapor is reactive and variable**
    + **10 day residence time**
    + seasonally and spatially

</div>

## Solar energy & water cycle connected
<hr>

<div class="centered"><strong><span style="color:red">25% of incoming solar energy leaves the surface through evaporation</span></strong></div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:225px; LEFT:200px; WIDTH:700px; HEIGHT:400px" SRC="images/Solar-Energy.jpg">

## Evapotranspiration: Energetics of water movement
<hr>
<br />
<br />
<br />

<div style="float: left; width: 50%;">

* **30% of oceans evaporate per year**
* **>60% of rainfall is lost to evapotranspiration**

<br />

* **Water has high specific heat**
    + 4x more energy to heat water than air
    + uses up solar energy 

<br />

* **Large energy fluxes when water changes state**
    + evapotranspiration cools surfaces
    + condensation warms atmosphere

</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:200px; LEFT:600px; WIDTH:400px; HEIGHT:400px" SRC="images/evapotrans.png">
